The Five Pillars

The basics. If you're following these five things, you're golden. If you do not follow these five 'pillars,' then you may be subject to in-game consequences like forced-replacement or modkilling, or site-wide consequences like bans.


  1. This is a game. Have fun! But do so in the spirit of the game - respect others' freedom to have fun!
  2. Common sense reigns supreme. Anything not covered explicitly in the rules should be able to be filled by your own common sense. If anything isn't clear or you find a loophole somehow or if you have any questions whatsoever, don't hesitate to PM me!
  3. Don't be intentionally annoying. Similarly to the above pillars, share your fun with others, rather than having fun at the expense of others. If you're especially peeved, consider taking a step away from the computer for a bit or PM me if you have a serious issue with someone or something.
  4. Make sure you're familiar with the Site Rules and Guidelines. This site is privately owned, so if you don't follow their rules, you should expect a swift and appropriate consequence, though if you're following the above pillars, you should be fine anyway.
  5. Familiarize yourself with my game rules. There may be new or different stuff than what you're used to, especially if the game is non-standard.


General Game Rules

Please note that these are generally applicable. Any of these rules may be overridden by the Game-Specific Rules.

  1. I suck. I make mistakes/poor decisions, etc. Please correct me if you feel I am wrong! If you have anything that you want me to see in the thread, be sure to put a bolded @Prof or @Fridays or @mod or @Walrus - basically, this helps me see your comment and that it's directed at me. Other ways of getting my attention are fine, just don't be obtrusive or annoying, and do so at the risk of my not seeing it.
  2. Games have Day and Night phases with a Day start unless otherwise stated in the Game-Specific Rules.
  3. An in-game Day will last 8 days. An in-game Night lasts 48 hours. If a majority is not reached before the deadline, it is a No Lynch. Deadline extensions may occur when deemed appropriate.
  4. A majority of votes is required for a lynch (or "No Lynch").
  5. Votes must be bolded by using either of the following methods:
    Code: Select all
    [b]Vote Prof Fridays[/b] ; [vote]Prof Fridays[/vote]
    If you do not vote in either way, it is up to me to determine whether or not I count the vote, so "fake-vote" at your own risk.
  6. Prod system: Players who have not posted for 48 hours will be prodded; players who do not post within 36 hours of a prod will be replaced. If you were to be prodded twice over a game Day or thrice over the whole game, you may be replaced at my discretion. If you have declared V/LA, you may be exempted from prods during that time at my discretion.
  7. In the event replacements are necessary, the deadline may be extended at my discretion.
  8. Do not post in the game thread after being 'killed.' There will be a dead thread. Be sad there.
  9. I reserve the right to force-replace, modkill, or take any action on any player at any point without warning. I also reserve the right to change anything in the rules at any point without warning.

Game-Specific Rules

These are special rules that apply to this particular game.

  1. This is a Normal Game, and thus has no special rules.
  2. Any flavor used by the moderator is not intended to divulge any information about the game state.
  3. Below you can find a sample Vanilla Townie role PM:

Prof FridaysYou are a Vanilla Townie. You have no special abilities, but you have a brain and a vote - make them count!

You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated.
DEADLINE: (expired on 2014-11-13 18:30:00)

That's not quite true. There are a couple reasons scum might unvote there:
1) Reducing the overall count on the wagon, keeping people from thinking it is attainable. For instance, someone is much more likely to jump on a wagon (IMO) when we are approaching deadline that is at L-2 than L-3.
2) To express some level of dissatisfaction with the wagon. This could cause others to re-think and jump off or dissuade non-voters from jumping on

Either of these could be done in an effort to stop a wagon on scum or to secure a NL.

The unvote can also be done by town, but it doesn't completely make sense, because no one should really be worried about a quick-lynch at this point in the game.
